segment.source: How to turn on Enterprise Mode and specify a site list.
segment.target: How to turn on Enterprise Mode and specify a site list.

segment.source: Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list
segment.target: Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: Before you can use a site list with Enterprise Mode, you need to turn the functionality on and set up the system for centralized control.
segment.target: Before you can use a site list with Enterprise Mode, you need to turn the functionality on and set up the system for centralized control.

segment.source: By allowing centralized control, you can create one global list of websites that render using Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: By allowing centralized control, you can create one global list of websites that render using Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: Approximately 65 seconds after Internet Explorer 11 starts, it looks for a properly formatted site list.
segment.target: Approximately 65 seconds after Internet Explorer 11 starts, it looks for a properly formatted site list.

segment.source: If a new site list if found, with a different version number than the active list, IE11 loads and uses the newer version.
segment.target: If a new site list if found, with a different version number than the active list, IE11 loads and uses the newer version.

segment.source: After the initial check, IE11 won’t look for an updated list again until you restart the browser.
segment.target: After the initial check, IE11 won’t look for an updated list again until you restart the browser.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: We recommend that you store and download your website list from a secure web sever (https://), to help protect against data tampering.
segment.target: We recommend that you store and download your website list from a secure web sever (https://), to help protect against data tampering.

segment.source: After the list is downloaded, it's stored locally on your employee’s computers so if the centralized file location is unavailable, they can still use Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: After the list is downloaded, it's stored locally on your employee’s computers so if the centralized file location is unavailable, they can still use Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: To turn on Enterprise Mode using Group Policy
segment.target: To turn on Enterprise Mode using Group Policy

originalData.data: `Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Internet Explorer\Use the Enterprise Mode IE website list`

segment.source: Open your Group Policy editor and go to the setting.
segment.target: Open your Group Policy editor and go to the setting.

segment.source: Turning this setting on also requires you to create and store a site list.
segment.target: Turning this setting on also requires you to create and store a site list.

segment.source: For more information about creating your site list, see the Use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager topics.
segment.target: For more information about creating your site list, see the Use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager topics.

segment.source: local group policy editor for using a site list
segment.target: local group policy editor for using a site list

segment.source: Click Enabled, and then in the Options area, type the location to your site list.
segment.target: Click Enabled, and then in the Options area, type the location to your site list.

segment.source: To turn on Enterprise Mode using the registry
segment.target: To turn on Enterprise Mode using the registry

segment.source: For only the local user: Open a registry editor, like regedit.exe and go to .
segment.target: For only the local user: Open a registry editor, like regedit.exe and go to .

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: For all users on the device: Open a registry editor, like regedit.exe and go to .
segment.target: For all users on the device: Open a registry editor, like regedit.exe and go to .

segment.source: Edit the registry key to point to where you want to keep your Enterprise Mode site list file.
segment.target: Edit the registry key to point to where you want to keep your Enterprise Mode site list file.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: enterprise mode with site list in the registry
segment.target: enterprise mode with site list in the registry

segment.source: HTTP location:
segment.target: HTTP location:

segment.source: Local network:
segment.target: Local network:

segment.source: Local file:
segment.target: Local file:

segment.source: All of your managed devices must have access to this location if you want them to be able to access and use Enterprise Mode and your site list.
segment.target: All of your managed devices must have access to this location if you want them to be able to access and use Enterprise Mode and your site list.

segment.source: For information about how to create and use an Enterprise Mode site list, see Use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager.
segment.target: For information about how to create and use an Enterprise Mode site list, see Use the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager.
